message:
One of the programs we use to help find, sort out and resolve Usability and Accessibility issues is SiteSort. For the most part, it helps find things that we just didn't think about when coding a new site (or may have forgot to do). One of the most common alerts we get is "This page has links to a PDF file, but does not provide a link to download Acrobat Reader."

Their reasoning? "When a web page requires that an applet, plug-in or other application be present on the client system to interpret page content, the page must provide a link to a plug-in or applet that complies with S1194.21(a) through (l)."

So, question: does the UI/UX community here on Convore agree with the idea that a PDF reader link needs to go on these pages?

Question: does Windows come with a preinstalled reader? If not, this is certainly a fair point. We haven't been linking to a reader in quite a while because OSX comes with one (as do most mobiles). But if Windows doesn't, the notification is definitely valid for accessibility purposes.
